forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 4am. Mostly cloudy. Low around 43, with temperatures rising to around 45 overnight. East wind around 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 4pm. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 54. East southeast wind 3 to 12 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn unfurls its gray tendrils over Downtown San Francisco, a shroud of clouds lingers, promising a day where sunlight will only occasionally pierce through. The air is cool, sitting just above 43 degrees, with a gentle east wind carrying the scent of impending rain. A light patter of droplets is expected to begin making their serenade before morning gives way to the busyness of Wednesday, as the skies continue their muted display, obscured by the fog that blankets the city like a delicate silk coverlet.

While rain is sure to grace our streets by late afternoon, early hours are marked by a melancholy sort of beauty, one that may tempt a stroll beneath an umbrella or a quiet morning spent in a cozy café. Those venturing outside should dress in layers, perhaps with a light jacket to ward off the chill, while sturdy shoes may be wise as the ground becomes slick. The promise of rain beckons one to embrace indoor activities later—think of a leisurely visit to a museum or an afternoon spent browsing the aisles of an independent bookstore, where the scents of aged paper and fresh coffee intermingle. Such pursuits might offer warmth against the damp chill outside, as the clouds prepare to release their burden onto the city below.
